joehung302 wrote:
> The idea is like this. For example, if the seed list is cnn.com, we 
> want to get every page under cnn.com, and every link that goes out of 
> cnn.com...but only one level deep for all the outgoing links.
> 
> Is it possible to configure Heritrix to crawl this way?

For 1 hop, yes, it's very easy:

Set the 'also-check-via' setting to 'true' on any SURT/host/etc. scoping 
rule you've set up. Then, it will ACCEPT URIs which are directly 
matched, or whose 'via' (1-hop-ago) URI matches.

Note that if you have other rules (transclusion) for getting embedded 
resources, these still work and so in practice with such rules you may 
go more than 1-hop-off.

(To do N-hops-off would require some custom coding.)

- Gordon @ IA
